channel.title: Gati Aher's Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Gati Aher's Blog

item.title: Experiments in Handwriting Detection With Faster R-CNN
item.description: 1 INTRODUCTION 1.1 Datasets 1.2 Tough-to-Beat Baseline Model 2 BACKGROUND INFORMATION 2.1 Overview of Detectron-v2’s Faster R-CNN with FPN - DataMapper - Backbone Network - Details on Feature Pyramid Network - Region Proposal Network (RPN) - RPN Head - Map Ground Truths to Feature Maps With Cell Anchors (during training) - Loss Function (during training) - Box Proposal Selection - ROI Head - Re-Sampling and Matching (during training) - Cropping - Box Head - Loss Calculation - Inference 2.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m currently a software engineering student at Olin College of Engineering in Needham, MA. I am most passionate about data analysis, machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision. If you are curious about my professional experience, see my CV. Contact Email: gativaher@gmail.com Github: @GatiAher LinkedIn: gatiaher Fun fact: Gati means velocity in Sanskrit. My full name, Gati Vikas Aher, roughly translates to the definition of instantaneous velocity (via a bilingual pun).

item.title: Data Structures for Large Scale Information Retrieval
item.description: 5-minute video overview: 1 INTRODUCTION 2 BACKGROUND INFORMATION 2.1 Inverted Indexes For Fast (Constant Time) Lookup 2.2 Big Document IDs Use a Lot of Space 2.3 An Overview of Compression Codes: Balancing Space Savings and Time Cost 3 ELIAS-FANO COMPRESSION 3.1 Introducing Quasi-Succinct Elias-Fano: Fast, Small and Better than Sequential Decoding 3.2 Speed-Up Elias-Fano with Quantum Skipping 3.3 Review of Elias-Fano 4 PARTITIONED ELIAS-FANO COMPRESSION 4.

item.title: Bloom for Search From Scratch
item.description: 1 PROJECT GOALS AND RESULTS 2 BLOOM FILTERS 2.1 Demo 1: Bloom filter to spellcheck a query 2.2 Demo 2: Bloom filter to spellcheck a file 3 BIT-SLICED DOCUMENT SIGNATURES 3.1 Demo 3: Information retrieval on xkcd comics transcripts 4 APPENDIX 4.1 Note on Code Design 4.1.1 Bit-wise functions that take advantage of powers of 2 4.1.2 Function pointers for cleaner, reusable code 4.

item.title: Eigenfaces and Out of Distribution Data
item.description: 1 INTRODUCTION Dataset 2 FACIAL RECOGNITION WITH NEAREST NEIGHBOR DISTANCE Room for Improvement PCA Toy Example 3 FACIAL RECOGNITION WITH PCA NEAREST NEIGHBOR DISTANCE Step 1. Standardize Dataset Step 2. Compute Sample Covariance Matrix from Standardized Train Dataset Step 3. Compute Eigenvectors and Eigenvalues of the Covariance Matrix Step 4. Pick k Eigenvectors Step 5. Project and Reconstruct Dataset onto k Eigenvectors Step 6.

item.title: Spectral Analysis of Bacteria S-Layer
item.description: 1 INTRODUCTION 2 BACKGROUND INFORMATION Bacteria S-Layers FFT In Python Code 3 APPLYING, CLEANING, AND INTERPRETING THE 2D FFT Step 1. Remove Vertical and Horizontal Pattern Noise Step 2. Identify Key Periodic Frequencies Step 3. Calculate Size and Scale Step 4. Identify Shape Bonus: Visualize the S-Layer Units 4 CONCLUSION 1 INTRODUCTION In 2015-2016, Professor Jean Huang and her research group cultured a phototrophic bacteria from the Little Sippewissett Salt Marsh.

item.title: 1D and 2D Fourier Transforms
item.description: 1 INTRODUCTION 2 1D FOURIER TRANSFORM Understanding the 1D Math The DFT-matrix (W) Post Projection Processing Read the 1D Frequency Plots 3 GENERALIZING TO 2D FOURIER TRANSFORM Understand the 2D Math Read the 2D Plots Exercises 4 FURTHER READING 1 INTRODUCTION In the 1800s, Joseph Fourier showed that periodic functions could be written as an infinite sum of sinusoids. His theory paved the way for Fourier Analysis, a useful tool for signal and data processing.
